intro: Memora aspericarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded memora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, textured fruits. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a serrated edge. Memora aspericarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
